intro: Pyrostria longicorollata, commonly known as the long-corolla pyrostria, is a rare and unique member of the Araliaceae family. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its striking, elongated corolla that gives it its common name. Its leaves are typically large, heart-shaped, and have a velvety texture. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Pyrostria longicorollata is considered an endangered species.
